etymology.description: semantic: 子 (“child; son”) + phonetic: 皿 (OC *maŋʔ)
etymology.interpretation: 子 signals the semantic field of personhood or kinship (originally “child”), while 皿 contributes the sound, aligning with Old Chinese maŋʔ toward modern mèng. The graph came to denote the eldest among siblings and later served as a surname.

examples.chinese: 孟先生今天来了(孟先生今天來了)。
我在图书馆读《孟子》(我在圖書館讀《孟子》)。
examples.english: I am reading Mencius in the library.

examples.chinese: 孟家的历史可以追溯到春秋时期(孟家的歷史可以追溯到春秋時期)。
examples.pinyin: Mèng jiā de lìshǐ kěyǐ zhuīsù dào Chūnqiū shíqī.
examples.english: The Meng family's history can be traced back to the Spring and Autumn period.
